sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Jhey Tompkins)
articles.description: One of Jhey’s main mantras is to make learning fun.  In this article, he shows you ways to level up your skills by bringing your ideas to life, and not forgetting that [you can be playful with code](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/11/playfulness-code-supercharge-fun-learning/). With that mindset, every idea is bound to become an opportunity to try something new.
articles.title: 3D CSS Flippy Snaps With React And GreenSock

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Nirmalya Ghosh)
articles.description: In this article, Nirmalya discusses some of the complex problems that he faced while building and maintaining large Next.js applications. He always explains how these problems can be solved by using various tools.
articles.title: How To Maintain A Large Next.js Application

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Instead of spending your coffee break scrolling through your social feeds, how about a lovely little website instead? We came across some fantastic ones that are just too good not to be shared. But be warned, your break might take a bit longer than intended.
articles.title: A Showcase Of Lovely Little Websites

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (John C Barstow)
articles.description: With a little CSS, we can adapt our web designs to be more accommodating for people with dyslexia. In this article, we’ll explore those techniques by adding a dyslexia-friendly mode to an existing design.
articles.title: Adding A Dyslexia-Friendly Mode To A Website

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Iris Lješnjanin)
articles.description: What’s the state of CSS, Vue.js and Next.js? What are new, smart interface design patterns we could use? Let’s figure it out. With our [online workshops on UX, front-end and design](https://smashingconf.com/online-workshops).
articles.title: Smashing Workshops: Winter 2021

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Dan Shappir)
articles.description: Implementing a performance culture is very important. In this article, Dan Shappir shares which actions and processes the Wix team put in place in order to achieve dramatic improvements in the performance of websites built and hosted on their platform.
articles.title: Improving The Performance Of Wix Websites (Case Study)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Sam Poder)
articles.description: Hosting with a wildcard subdomain enables your users to visit your site on any subdomain of your domain (*.example.com), and as you can imagine, we can use this to create unique user experiences which we’ll be exploring in this article through a Next.js lens.
articles.title: Next.js Wildcard Subdomains

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Michelle Barker)
articles.description: In this article, we’ll take a look at the best ways to handle colors in CSS today, some tips for using them in a design system, and what we can expect from our colors in the not-too-distant future.
articles.title: A Guide To Modern CSS Colors With RGB, HSL, HWB, LAB And LCH

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: Meet “Touch Design for Mobile Interfaces”, our brand-new guide on designing for mobile with proven, universal, human-centric standards. 400 pages. Shipping starting in early January.
articles.title: Meet Touch Design For Mobile Interfaces, A New Smashing Book By Steven Hoober

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Louis Lazaris)
articles.description: What’s your favorite command-line tool? In this post, Louis Lazaris shares a collection of relevant command-line apps and utilities that he has personally come across in the past few years. If there’s a useful one that hasn’t been mentioned and one you use regularly, please do share it in the comments.
articles.title: Powerful Terminal And Command-Line (CLI) Tools For Modern Web Development

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ifeanyi Dike)
articles.description: The React team introduced several hooks in React 16.8 which you can use from third-party providers in your application, or even create your own custom hook. In this tutorial, we’ll take a look at some of the most useful hooks in React and how to use them.
articles.title: Useful React Hooks That You Can Use In Your Projects

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adam Fard)
articles.description: Dribbbleshots just might be the hotbed of questionable dashboards. Striking visuals, little context, and no research: all recipes for mediocrity. Mediocrity won’t do. We’ll pursue greatness. And in that pursuit, we’ll cover research, decluttering, and data visualization.
articles.title: From Good To Great In Dashboard Design: Research, Decluttering And Data Viz

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Átila Fassina)
articles.description: Internationalized routing is not exactly a new feature on Next.js. In this article, we are not only checking what we get from this feature, but also how to leverage such functionalities to achieve the best user experience and a smooth developer experience as well.
articles.title: Localizing Your Next.js App

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Leonardo Losoviz)
articles.description: In this article, Leonardo Losoviz explains how Cloudinary’s integration can be used with WordPress to produce and deliver optimal digital experiences.
articles.title: Automatically Transforming And Optimizing Images And Videos On Your WordPress Website

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ilya Grigorik)
articles.description: A great commerce experience is not a Lighthouse score or a set of Core Web Vitals figures (although both are important inputs), but it’s also a trilemma that carefully balances competing needs of delivering a great customer experience, dynamic storefront capabilities and long-term business objectives.
articles.title: Meet Hydrogen: A React Framework For Dynamic, Contextual And Personalized E-Commerce

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Victor Yocco)
articles.description: Concept testing ideas before moving into a detailed design is good UX practice. In this article, Victor Yocco presents details on how and when to engage in concept testing, as well as case studies providing details on the insights gained in two very different settings.
articles.title: The Value Of Concept Testing As Part Of Product Design

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Drew McLellan)
articles.description: In this episode, we’re talking about Astro. Will this modern static site builder launch you into the stratosphere? Drew McLellan talks to developer Matthew Phillips to find out.
articles.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 43 With Matthew Phillips: What Is Astro?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (David Atanda)
articles.description: Within the last decade, technologies like GraphQL have changed how we build web apps and how they communicate with each other. GraphQL provides certain benefits over REST APIs — let’s find out what they are.
articles.title: GraphQL On The Front-End (React And Apollo)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ikeh Akinyemi)
articles.description: Serverless UI is simply a free, open-source command-line utility for quickly building and deploying serverless applications on the AWS platform. In this article, we will learn and cover everything needed on using Serverless UI to deploy our projects or serverless applications to cloud services providers.
articles.title: A Deep Dive Into Serverless UI With TypeScript

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Alex Husar)
articles.description: This article sheds the spotlight on Magento PWAs and explains why business owners are getting them (often instead of native applications). Alex Husar introduces ways of how progressive web applications can be developed on Magento, as well as go over the major pros and cons of each development path.
articles.title: Creating A Magento PWA: Customizing Themes vs. Coding From Scratch

articles.description: How you train for your career is one of the most consequential decisions you'll ever make. But it's hard to narrow down your options for a career in software development or IT. Medicine is easy: pick a medical school and apply. But programming?  Will what you learn in a four
articles.title: Types of Software Development Training – A Data Analysis of IT Career Training Tool Efficacy

articles.description: Many software applications need to exchange data between a client and server.  For a long time, XML was the preferred data format when it came to information exchange between the two points. Then in early 2000, JSON was introduced as an alternate data format for information exchange. In this article,
articles.title: JSON for Beginners – JavaScript Object Notation Explained in Plain English

articles.description: These 7 tricks and tips will take you from 50% to 90% accuracy for your image recognition models in literally minutes. So, you have gathered a dataset, built a neural network, and trained your model. But despite the hours (and sometimes days) of work you've invested to create the model,
articles.title: How to Improve the Accuracy of Your Image Recognition Models

articles.description: When you're programming, you'll often need to switch between data types.
